alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Clark; Greene; Logan; Miami; Montgomery; Shelby (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 3:29PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SHELBY, WESTERN CHAMPAIGN, SOUTHWESTERN LOGAN, WESTERN CLARK, NORTHWESTERN GREENE, EASTERN MONTGOMERY AND MIAMI COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 329 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Versailles to near Dayton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Kettering, Beavercreek, Huber Heights, Fairborn, Troy, Trotwood, Sidney, Piqua, Miamisburg, Vandalia, Englewood, Tipp City, Moraine, New Carlisle, West Milton, Oakwood, Wright-Patterson Afb, West Carrollton and Covington. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 27 and 48. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 46 and 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Champaign; Clark; Greene; Logan; Miami; Montgomery; Shelby
